LanguageData.MethadoneTolerance.label: methadone tolerance
LanguageData.MethadoneTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to methadone. The more severe this tolerance is, the more methadone it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.MethadoneTolerance.stages.0.label: small
LanguageData.MethadoneTolerance.stages.1.label: large
LanguageData.MethadoneTolerance.stages.2.label: massive
LanguageData.MethadoneAddiction.label: methadone addiction
LanguageData.MethadoneAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to methadone. Long-term presence of methadone has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug.\nWithout regular doses of methadone, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.MethadoneAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
